title: rProject
text:
Initial setup
Publish the project to Quarto Pub interactively by typing
Save the generated _publish.yml. Once the _publish.yml is generated, the succeeding builds will be handled by GitHub actions.

title: Introduction
text:
The R project rProject contains a collection of functions to setup personal R projects. For example, rProject::BuildIgnore() generates the .Rbuildignore for my personal R projects.

?BuildIgnore







BuildIgnore
R Documentation





Build .Rbuildignore

Description

Build .Rbuildignore



Usage

BuildIgnore(path, project, add = NULL)



Arguments





path
Character string. Project path.


project
Character string. Project name.


add
Character vector. Items to add to .Rbuildignore.






Author(s)

Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan









BuildIgnore

function (path, project, add = NULL) 
{
    if (file.exists(file.path(path, "DESCRIPTION"))) {
        x <- c(".*\\.Rcheck$", ".*\\.Rproj$", ".*\\.sif$", "^CITATION\\.cff$", 
            "^LICENSE\\.md$", "^Makefile$", "^README\\.Rmd$", 
            "^README\\.md$", "^\\.Rproj\\.user$", "^\\.devcontainer$", 
            "^\\.git.*$", "^\\.library$", "^\\.quarto$", "^\\.setup$", 
            "^\\.sif$", "^\\.sim$", "^detritus$", "^index\\.qmd$", 
            "^pkgdown$", "^quarto$", "^scripts$")
        if (!is.null(add)) {
            x <- c(x, add)
        }
        con <- file(file.path(path, ".Rbuildignore"))
        writeLines(text = x, con = con, sep = "\n")
        close(con)
    }
    else {
        message(paste(path, "is not an R package."))
    }
}
